required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on December 16, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Radiotherapy and Anti-PD-1 in Low-risk ES-ENKTCL
clinical_study.official_title: Radiotherapy With Inductive and Concurrent Anti-PD-1 Antibody in Early-stage Low-risk Extranodal NK/T Cell Lymphoma, Nasal Type: A Multi-center Phase II Study

collaborator.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Jilin University
Affiliated Cancer Hospital & Institute of Guangzhou Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The current study is a phase II multi-center single arm trial to evaluate the efficacy and safety of adding Anti-PD-1 antibody in an inductive and concurrent way to radiotherapy in early-stage low-risk extranodal NK/T cell lymphoma, nasal type

primary_outcome.measure: Rate of Complete response after inductive therapy
primary_outcome.description: complete resolution of disease in imaging and biopsy after inductive therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-free survival rate at year 2 after enrollment, 2y-PFS
secondary_outcome.description: From enrollment to any disease progression or death

secondary_outcome.measure: Overall Survival rate at year 2/5 after enrollment，2y-/5y-OS
Rate of acute toxicity (any and above grade 3)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From enrollment to 3 months after treatment

other_outcome.measure: Biomarkers to predict anti-PD-1 antibody efficacy and 2y-PFS
other_outcome.description: potential biomarkers in baseline tumor samples and blood samples

clinical_study.condition: Extranodal NK-T-Cell Lymphoma, Nasal and Nasal-Type

arm_group.arm_group_label: Inductive and concurrent anti-PD-1 antibody combined with radiotherapy
arm_group.description: All the enrolled patients receive 2 doses of inductive anti-PD-1 antibody (Tislelizumab 200mg) every two weeks, and then Involved-site radiotherapy (50±6-10 Gy) with concurrent anti-PD-1 antibody (Tislelizumab 200mg) every two weeks.

intervention.description: inductive Anti-PD-1 antibody + concurrent Anti-PD-1 antibody with RT
intervention.arm_group_label: Inductive and concurrent anti-PD-1 antibody combined with radiotherapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Biopsy proved extranodal NK/T cell lymphoma
- No previous anti-cancer treatment
- Measurable lesion on baseline PET/CT and MRI
- Stage I
- Normal serum LDH level
- Primary tumor invasion (PTI) absence
- ECOG PS 0-1
- Sufficient organ functions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other mature T- or NK- lymphoma
- Hemophagocytic lymphohistiocytosis
- Primary CNS lymphoma or CNS-involved lymphoma
- History of malignancy except for cutaneous basal-/squamous- cell carcinoma or cervical carcinoma in situ 3 years prior to study treatment

facility.name: National Cancer Center/National Clinical Research Center for Cancer/Cancer Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences and Peking Union Medical College

responsible_party.investigator_title: Associated Prof. in the radiation oncology department

patient_data.ipd_description: All IPD that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: From: 6 months after publication. To: 5 years after publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Will share data with the PIs who had specific study plan in immunotherapy area and biomarker area
